meanings.definition: Involving three or more parties or countries.
meanings.sent1: The multilateral agreement was signed by several nations.
meanings.sent2: The United Nations is known for its multilateral approach to global issues.
meanings.sent3: The multilateral meeting turned into a lively discussion among the different countries.
meanings.sent4: The multilateral negotiations were like a complex puzzle with many pieces.
meanings.sent5: The multilateral decision-making process required input from multiple countries.

meanings.sent1: The issue had a multilateral impact on various areas of society.
meanings.sent2: Her argument was multilateral, considering all angles of the situation.
meanings.sent3: The multilateral view of the problem revealed unexpected connections.
meanings.sent4: His personality was like a multilateral prism, reflecting different facets of his character.
meanings.sent5: The multilateral nature of the project made it challenging but rewarding.
